intro: Palafoxia linearis var. arenicola, commonly known as sandplain palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This variant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and open woodlands. The plant is adapted to harsh, arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils through its extensive root system.
